Description: Double reed pipe with a long drone in two sections (one may be missing). Sections bound together and to chanter with twisted cotton thread. Single split reeds in top of chanter and drone; chanter has six evenly spaced finger holes.
Curator's comments: Information derived from a) original Wellcome collection labels and b) worksheets, compiled by Ethnography Dept. staff, which are stored with Africa collections. Wellcome label records 'Double reed pipe called by modern Egyptians "arghool".'
Condition: Fair; thread is loose in places, part of drone may be missing.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine
